bin/subprob.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Sub-problem generator.
00003  *
00004  * Generates a sub-problem from a larger one by outputing data for nodes on
00005  * the interval [start, end].
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup bin
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 
00012 /* Global variables */
00013 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00014 char *input_file = NULL;        /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00015 int start = 0;                  /**< Starting city index */
00016 int end = 1;                    /**< Ending city index */
00017 
00018 /* Program options */
00019 #define NUM_OPTS 3
00020 arrow_option options[NUM_OPTS] = 
00021 {
00022     {'i', "input", "TSPLIB input file", 
00023         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &input_file, ARROW_TRUE, ARROW_TRUE},
00024     {'s', "start", "TSPLIB input file", 
00025         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &start, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00026     {'e', "end", "TSPLIB input file", 
00027         ARROW_OPTION_INT, &end, ARROW_TRUE, ARROW_TRUE}
00028 };
00029 char *desc = "Generates a sub-problem from a larger one";
00030 char *usage = "-i tsplib.tsp -s # -e #";
00031 
00032 /* Main Method */
00033 int 
00034 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00035 {   
00036     int ret = EXIT_SUCCESS;
00037     int stdout_id;
00038     
00039     /* Read program arguments */
00040     if(!arrow_options_parse(NUM_OPTS, options, desc, usage, argc, argv, NULL))
00041         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00042     
00043     /* Need to supress output from Concorde */
00044     arrow_util_redirect_stdout_to_file(ARROW_DEV_NULL, &stdout_id);
00045     
00046     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00047     arrow_problem problem;
00048     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00049         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00050     
00051     /* Restore output */
00052     arrow_util_restore_stdout(stdout_id);
00053     
00054     if((start >= 0) && (start <= end) && (end <= problem.size))
00055     {
00056         printf("NAME: %s[%d,%d]\n", problem.name, start, end);
00057         printf("TYPE: %s\n", (problem.symmetric ? "TSP" : "ATSP"));
00058         printf("DIMENSION: %d\n", end - start + 1);
00059         printf("EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE: EXPLICIT\n");
00060         printf("EDGE_WEIGHT_FORMAT: FULL_MATRIX\n");
00061         printf("EDGE_WEIGHT_SECTION\n");
00062         
00063         int i, j;
00064         for(i = start; i <= end; i++)
00065         {
00066             for(j = start; j <= end; j++)
00067             {
00068                 printf("%d\t", problem.get_cost(&problem, i, j));
00069             }
00070             printf("\n");
00071         } 
00072         printf("EOF\n");
00073     }
00074     else
00075     {
00076         arrow_print_error("Invalid start/end bounds!\n");
00077         ret = EXIT_FAILURE;
00078     }
00079     
00080     /* Free up the structure */
00081     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00082     return ret;
00083 }
